info.description: A Lucidworks Fusion microservice for CRUD operations on templates and zones, and for retrieving and rendering templates for particular navigation states
info.title: Fusion Templating API

tags.name: render-controller
tags.description: Endpoints for retrieving and rendering templates for particular navigation states

tags.name: template-settings-controller
tags.description: CRUD endpoint for general configuration of Templating service

tags.name: trigger-controller
tags.description: Endpoints for getting the template that triggers for a given nav state, without rendering.

get.summary: Retrieve and render the template for the given navigation state. By default will only trigger published versions of templates, specify staging=true to instead trigger staging versions of templates.
get.description: navigation state is determined by the query terms (q) and filters (fq) in the query params, all other params will be passed through to any query profiles invoked during rendering.

parameters.name: app
parameters.description: Application ID

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: Query parameters

parameters.name: showInactive
parameters.description: Legacy. Same as staging parameter. Triggers staging templates instead of published templates when true.

parameters.name: staging
parameters.description: Triggers staging templates instead of published templates when true.

parameters.name: templateTypes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of template types, indicating which possible types of templates to trigger (e.g. landing, item-detail...)

post.summary: Retrieve and render the template for the given navigation state. By default will only trigger published versions of templates, specify staging=true to instead trigger staging versions of templates.
post.description: navigation state is determined by the query terms (q) and filters (fq) in the query params, all other params will be passed through to any query profiles invoked during rendering.

parameters.name: app
parameters.description: Application ID

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: Query parameters

post.summary: Retrieve and render the template for the given navigation state. By default will only trigger published versions of templates, specify staging=true to instead trigger staging versions of templates. The provided DSL request object + any additional request parameters are passed through to each query profile when rendering each zone.
post.description: navigation state is determined from the dsl object by the userQuery (for the search terms) and the filters (for the filter values).

parameters.name: app
parameters.description: Application ID

parameters.name: dslRequest
parameters.description: DSL request, used to determine navigation state and will be passed through to the indicated query profiles when rendering each zone.

parameters.name: requestParams
parameters.description: Additional request parameters, will be passed through to the query profile when rendering a zone. If there is a 'tags' parameter it will be merged with any tags configured in the zones.

parameters.name: staging
parameters.description: Triggers staging templates instead of published templates when true.

parameters.name: templateTypes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of template types, indicating which possible types of templates to trigger (e.g. landing, item-detail...)

get.summary: Retrieve and render the template with the specified id. All provided query params will be passed on to each query profile invoked during rendering.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: Query parameters, will be passed through to the query profiles when rendering each zone.

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: Template ID

post.summary: Retrieve and render the template with the specified id. All provided query params will be passed on to each query profile invoked during rendering.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: Query parameters, will be passed through to the query profiles when rendering each zone.

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: Template ID

post.summary: Retrieve and render the template with the specified id, passing the provided DSL request to each query profile invoked during rendering.

parameters.name: dslRequest
parameters.description: DSL request, will be passed through to the indicated query profiles when rendering each zone.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: Query parameters

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: Template ID

get.summary: Get all entities with optional params to filter the results. Each entity can have both a staging and published version, and the staging version is marked dirty if there are changes needing publication. The default behavior displays only the staging version of entities.  Setting hideStaging=true will exclude the staging version of entities from the response.  The context parameter filters entities based on which app they are part of by specifying, for example, app:SomeApp. Any other comma-separated contexts in the context parameter are allowed but ignored.

parameters.name: allRequestParams
parameters.description: allRequestParams

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context allows to specify the application

parameters.name: hideStaging
parameters.description: if true, will exclude the staging version of entities in the response.

parameters.name: showDirtyOnly
parameters.description: showDirtyOnly

parameters.name: showPublished
parameters.description: showPublished

post.summary: Create a new entity from JSON

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context allows to specify the application

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: A new entity serialized to JSON

post.summary: For internal use only. Import the entity from existing app. Same as the normal POST / create endpoint, but dirty flag / publish status will be preserved. Only to be used for imports / upgrades.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context allows to specify the application

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: Existing entity serialized to JSON

get.summary: Get JSON schema for objects managed by this API
Get the entity as JSON by unique ID

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context allows to specify the application

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The entity ID

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context allows to specify the application

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: An updated entity serialized to JSON

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The entity ID

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context allows to specify the application

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The entity ID

delete.summary: Deletes the entity immediately (no marking for deletion) without any other side effects. Does not perform any additional logic such as removing a deleted zone from any templates it was in or deleting orphaned zones. This is only intended to be used during app deletion and may produce unexpected behavior if used in other situations.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context allows to specify the application

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The entity ID

get.summary: Get all entities with optional params to filter the results. Each entity can have both a staging and published version, and the staging version is marked dirty if there are changes needing publication. The default behavior displays only the staging version of entities.  Setting hideStaging=true will exclude the staging version of entities from the response.  The context parameter filters entities based on which app they are part of by specifying, for example, app:SomeApp. Any other comma-separated contexts in the context parameter are allowed but ignored.

parameters.name: allRequestParams
parameters.description: allRequestParams

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context allows to specify the application

parameters.name: hideStaging
parameters.description: if true, will exclude the staging version of entities in the response.

parameters.name: showDirtyOnly
parameters.description: if true, will only show staging entities marked as dirty (will not show published entities).

parameters.name: showPublished
parameters.description: if true, will include the published version of entities in the response.

post.summary: Create a new template from JSON. This template will initially be dirty and unpublished and can be published using the publish endpoint. Operation will fail if any zones referenced in this template do not exist.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context allows to specify the application

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: A new template serialized to JSON

post.summary: For internal use only. Import the entity from existing app. Same as the normal POST / create endpoint, but dirty flag / publish status will be preserved. Only to be used for imports / upgrades.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context allows to specify the application

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: Existing entity serialized to JSON

get.summary: Get JSON schema for objects managed by this API

post.summary: Publish the current staging version of the template and all of its zones. They will appear in the published view of the templating service. This will publish the current version even if the template itself is not dirty. If the template is marked for deletion, this will instead delete the template and any newly-orphaned zones. Returns the new data of the staging template after publishing, or 204 NO CONTENT if it was deleted.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context allows to specify the application

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The template ID

get.summary: Lists of already used url context in Templates of selected app

parameters.name: app
parameters.description: Application ID

get.summary: Get the entity as JSON by unique ID

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context allows to specify the application

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The entity ID

put.summary: Update a template from JSON. This will make the template dirty, and the changes can be published using the publish endpoint. If any zones are removed from the template and no longer exist in any template, they will be considered as orphans and deleted. Operation will fail if any zones referenced in the updated template do not exist.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context allows to specify the application

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: An updated template serialized to JSON

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The template ID

delete.summary: Mark the template for deletion. The template will actually be deleted when published after being marked for deletion, even if the template has never been published prior to deletion. The new state of the template will be returned.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context allows to specify the application

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The template ID

delete.summary: Deletes the entity immediately (no marking for deletion) without any other side effects. Does not perform any additional logic such as removing a deleted zone from any templates it was in or deleting orphaned zones. This is only intended to be used during app deletion and may produce unexpected behavior if used in other situations.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context allows to specify the application

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The entity ID

post.summary: Partial update of Zone with PageMetadata. This will make the zone dirty, and the changes can be published using the publish endpoint.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context allows to specify the application

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: An updated zone serialized to JSON

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The template ID

get.summary: Retrieve the template that should trigger for the given navigation state. By default will only trigger published versions of templates, specify staging=true to instead trigger staging versions of templates.
get.description: navigation state is determined by the query terms (q) and filters (fq) in the query params.

parameters.description: Application ID

parameters.name: params

parameters.description: Legacy. Same as staging parameter. Triggers staging templates instead of published templates when true.

parameters.name: staging
parameters.description: Triggers staging templates instead of published templates when true.

parameters.name: templateTypes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of template types, indicating which possible types of templates to trigger (e.g. landing, item-detail...)

parameters.description: The entity ID

Does not perform any additional logic such as removing a deleted zone from any templates it was in or deleting orphaned zones. This is only intended to be used during app deletion and may produce unexpected behavior if used in other situations.

exact.description: If true (defaults to false), the nav state must match exactly this trigger's criteria - i.e. if true, no extra filters are allowed, and no search terms are allowed if this trigger has none defined. Not to be confused with 'exact' match mode which specifically defines the search term matching logic.

filters.description: Filters (fq) values required in the query for this trigger to match. Additional filters may be present in the query (and still satisfy this trigger) unless 'exact: true' is specified for this trigger, in which case the filters in the query must exactly match the filters in this trigger, no more and no less.

KeyValueListTrigger.title: KeyValueListTrigger
KeyValueListTrigger.description: An individual trigger criteria for Key and Values filters. All the conditions indicated in the trigger must be satisfied for the trigger to be a match on a particular nav state.

exact.description: If true (defaults to false), the nav state must match exactly this trigger's criteria - i.e. if true, no extra filters are allowed, and no search terms are allowed if this trigger has none defined. Not to be confused with 'exact' match mode which specifically defines the search term matching logic.

filters.description: Filters (fq) values required in the query for this trigger to match. Additional filters may be present in the query (and still satisfy this trigger) unless 'exact: true' is specified for this trigger, in which case the filters in the query must exactly match the filters in this trigger, no more and no less.

KeyValueListTriggerReq.title: KeyValueListTriggerReq
KeyValueListTriggerReq.description: An individual trigger criteria for Key and Values filters. All the conditions indicated in the trigger must be satisfied for the trigger to be a match on a particular nav state.

exact.description: If true (defaults to false), the nav state must match exactly this trigger's criteria - i.e. if true, no extra filters are allowed, and no search terms are allowed if this trigger has none defined. Not to be confused with 'exact' match mode which specifically defines the search term matching logic.

filters.description: Filters (fq) values required in the query for this trigger to match. Additional filters may be present in the query (and still satisfy this trigger) unless 'exact: true' is specified for this trigger, in which case the filters in the query must exactly match the filters in this trigger, no more and no less.

KeyValueListTriggerRes.title: KeyValueListTriggerRes
KeyValueListTriggerRes.description: An individual trigger criteria for Key and Values filters. All the conditions indicated in the trigger must be satisfied for the trigger to be a match on a particular nav state.

PageMetadataZone.title: PageMetadataZone

dirty.description: Read only. True if this is the staging version of this template and it has changes which have not yet been published.

inTemplates.description: Read only. IDs of the templates this zone appears in, in no particular order

metadata.description: Extra arbitrary metadata associated with this zone, for things like PM UI data.

neverPublished.description: Read only. True if this zone has never been published (no published version of the zone exists).

published.description: Read only. True if this is the published version of this zone.

staging.description: Read only. True if this is the staging version of this zone.

type.description: Type of zone, a value classifying the zone.

allOf.title: PageMetadataZone
allOf.description: Zone config for page metadata information defined in pageMetadata list elements.

PageMetadataZone.description: Zone config for page metadata information defined in pageMetadata list elements.

dirty.description: Read only. True if this is the staging version of this template and it has changes which have not yet been published.

inTemplates.description: Read only. IDs of the templates this zone appears in, in no particular order

metadata.description: Extra arbitrary metadata associated with this zone, for things like PM UI data.

neverPublished.description: Read only. True if this zone has never been published (no published version of the zone exists).

type.description: Type of zone, a value classifying the zone.

allOf.title: PageMetadataZoneReq
allOf.description: Zone config for page metadata information defined in pageMetadata list elements.

PageMetadataZoneRes.title: PageMetadataZone

dirty.description: Read only. True if this is the staging version of this template and it has changes which have not yet been published.

inTemplates.description: Read only. IDs of the templates this zone appears in, in no particular order

metadata.description: Extra arbitrary metadata associated with this zone, for things like PM UI data.

neverPublished.description: Read only. True if this zone has never been published (no published version of the zone exists).

published.description: Read only. True if this is the published version of this zone.

staging.description: Read only. True if this is the staging version of this zone.

type.description: Type of zone, a value classifying the zone.

allOf.title: PageMetadataZoneRes
allOf.description: Zone config for page metadata information defined in pageMetadata list elements.

PageMetadataZoneRes.description: Zone config for page metadata information defined in pageMetadata list elements.

templateId.description: ID of the triggered template containing the rendered zones

RenderResponse.title: RenderResponse
RenderResponse.description: response from the render endpoint, holds the result of rendering all zones

render.description: rendered representation of the zone (schema depends on underlying query profile that was queried)

RenderedZone.title: RenderedZone
RenderedZone.description: A rendered zone with its accompanying zone configuration. Schema of the rendered data depends on the underlying query profile that the zone queried.

all.description: If true (defaults to false), this template will match at all nav states (triggers will be ignored).

dirty.description: Read only. True if this is the staging version of this template and it has changes to itself or any dirty zones which have not yet been published.

dirtyZoneIds.description: Read only. IDs of the zones in this template that are dirty.

endTime.description: Template will only be triggerable before this time.

markedForDeletion.description: Read only. True if this is the staging version of this template and it has been marked for deletion but the deletion has not yet been published. If marked for deletion, the template will be actually deleted upon being published.

metadata.description: Extra arbitrary metadata associated with this template, for things like PM UI data.

neverPublished.description: Read only. True if this template has never been published (no published version of the template exists).

priority.description: Used when multiple templates trigger in a given nav state - higher number means higher precedence. For example, a template with precedence of 10 will trigger before a template with precedence of 3.

published.description: Read only. True if this is the published version of this template.

staging.description: Read only. True if this is the staging version of this template.

startTime.description: Template will only be triggerable after this time.

templateDirty.description: Read only. True if this is the staging version of this template and it has changes to its own fields which have not yet been published. This is independent of any contained zones being dirty - it will be false if there are no changes to this template's fields but some of the contained zones are themselves dirty.

triggers.description: Triggers - only one trigger needs to be satisfied in order for this template to trigger.

type.description: Type of this template, an arbitrary value classifying the template. During triggering/rendering, the desired possible types of templates to trigger are specified in the request and compared against this field. Currently it is intended that this value is only set by the PM UI.

zoneIds.description: IDs of the zones in this template in the order they should appear.

Template.title: Template
Template.description: Ordered list of zones with associated trigger criteria.

all.description: If true (defaults to false), this template will match at all nav states (triggers will be ignored).

dirty.description: Read only. True if this is the staging version of this template and it has changes to itself or any dirty zones which have not yet been published.

dirtyZoneIds.description: Read only. IDs of the zones in this template that are dirty.

endTime.description: Template will only be triggerable before this time.

markedForDeletion.description: Read only. True if this is the staging version of this template and it has been marked for deletion but the deletion has not yet been published. If marked for deletion, the template will be actually deleted upon being published.

metadata.description: Extra arbitrary metadata associated with this template, for things like PM UI data.

neverPublished.description: Read only. True if this template has never been published (no published version of the template exists).

priority.description: Used when multiple templates trigger in a given nav state - higher number means higher precedence. For example, a template with precedence of 10 will trigger before a template with precedence of 3.

startTime.description: Template will only be triggerable after this time.

templateDirty.description: Read only. True if this is the staging version of this template and it has changes to its own fields which have not yet been published. This is independent of any contained zones being dirty - it will be false if there are no changes to this template's fields but some of the contained zones are themselves dirty.

triggers.description: Triggers - only one trigger needs to be satisfied in order for this template to trigger.

type.description: Type of this template, an arbitrary value classifying the template. During triggering/rendering, the desired possible types of templates to trigger are specified in the request and compared against this field. Currently it is intended that this value is only set by the PM UI.

zoneIds.description: IDs of the zones in this template in the order they should appear.

TemplateWithZones.title: TemplateWithZones
TemplateWithZones.description: Ordered list of zones with associated trigger criteria.

exact.description: If true (defaults to false), the nav state must match exactly this trigger's criteria - i.e. if true, no extra filters are allowed, and no search terms are allowed if this trigger has none defined. Not to be confused with 'exact' match mode which specifically defines the search term matching logic.

filters.description: Filters (fq) values required in the query for this trigger to match. Additional filters may be present in the query (and still satisfy this trigger) unless 'exact: true' is specified for this trigger, in which case the filters in the query must exactly match the filters in this trigger, no more and no less.

matchMode.description: Defines search terms matching criteria. 'phrase' (the default) requires the search tokens of this trigger to exist as a phrase within the search terms of the query, in the same order. 'all' requires the search tokens of this trigger to exist within the search terms of the query in any order. 'exact' requires that the search tokens in this trigger exactly match the search tokens in the query, in the same order. As with all match modes, 'exact' still applies the configured analysis, such as stemming, so singular / plural forms will be considered identical despite not being 'exactly' the same.

search.description: Search terms required in the query for this trigger to match. The configured analysis will be applied to tokenize and process these terms.

urlPath.description: URL path to which this trigger matches

Trigger.title: Trigger
Trigger.description: An individual trigger criteria for a template. All the conditions indicated in the trigger must be satisfied for the trigger to be a match on a particular nav state. A trigger consists of search (q) and filter (fq) criteria.

exact.description: If true (defaults to false), the nav state must match exactly this trigger's criteria - i.e. if true, no extra filters are allowed, and no search terms are allowed if this trigger has none defined. Not to be confused with 'exact' match mode which specifically defines the search term matching logic.

filters.description: Filters (fq) values required in the query for this trigger to match. Additional filters may be present in the query (and still satisfy this trigger) unless 'exact: true' is specified for this trigger, in which case the filters in the query must exactly match the filters in this trigger, no more and no less.

matchMode.description: Defines search terms matching criteria. 'phrase' (the default) requires the search tokens of this trigger to exist as a phrase within the search terms of the query, in the same order. 'all' requires the search tokens of this trigger to exist within the search terms of the query in any order. 'exact' requires that the search tokens in this trigger exactly match the search tokens in the query, in the same order. As with all match modes, 'exact' still applies the configured analysis, such as stemming, so singular / plural forms will be considered identical despite not being 'exactly' the same.

search.description: Search terms required in the query for this trigger to match. The configured analysis will be applied to tokenize and process these terms.

urlPath.description: URL path to which this trigger matches

TriggerReq.title: TriggerReq
TriggerReq.description: An individual trigger criteria for a template. All the conditions indicated in the trigger must be satisfied for the trigger to be a match on a particular nav state. A trigger consists of search (q) and filter (fq) criteria.

exact.description: If true (defaults to false), the nav state must match exactly this trigger's criteria - i.e. if true, no extra filters are allowed, and no search terms are allowed if this trigger has none defined. Not to be confused with 'exact' match mode which specifically defines the search term matching logic.

filters.description: Filters (fq) values required in the query for this trigger to match. Additional filters may be present in the query (and still satisfy this trigger) unless 'exact: true' is specified for this trigger, in which case the filters in the query must exactly match the filters in this trigger, no more and no less.

matchMode.description: Defines search terms matching criteria. 'phrase' (the default) requires the search tokens of this trigger to exist as a phrase within the search terms of the query, in the same order. 'all' requires the search tokens of this trigger to exist within the search terms of the query in any order. 'exact' requires that the search tokens in this trigger exactly match the search tokens in the query, in the same order. As with all match modes, 'exact' still applies the configured analysis, such as stemming, so singular / plural forms will be considered identical despite not being 'exactly' the same.

search.description: Search terms required in the query for this trigger to match. The configured analysis will be applied to tokenize and process these terms.

urlPath.description: URL path to which this trigger matches

TriggerRes.title: TriggerRes
TriggerRes.description: An individual trigger criteria for a template. All the conditions indicated in the trigger must be satisfied for the trigger to be a match on a particular nav state. A trigger consists of search (q) and filter (fq) criteria.

TriggerResponse.title: TriggerResponse
TriggerResponse.description: response from the trigger endpoint, holds the triggered template (if any)

dirty.description: Read only. True if this is the staging version of this template and it has changes which have not yet been published.

inTemplates.description: Read only. IDs of the templates this zone appears in, in no particular order

metadata.description: Extra arbitrary metadata associated with this zone, for things like PM UI data.

neverPublished.description: Read only. True if this zone has never been published (no published version of the zone exists).

published.description: Read only. True if this is the published version of this zone.

staging.description: Read only. True if this is the staging version of this zone.

type.description: Type of zone, a value classifying the zone.
